intro: Epipactis rubra var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features a rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, reddish-brown flowers with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It is characterized by its intricate floral structure and is pollinated by specific insect species. This orchid is listed as vulnerable in some regions due to habitat loss and fragmentation.
